content.question: If f and g are twice differentiable functions such that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4279@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>″</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4618@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DB4@</annotation> </semantics> </math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
